notes.text:
The OPC UA implementations (ANSI C and C++) as used in several SIMATIC  products contain a denial of service vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to create a denial of service condition by sending a specially crafted certificate.

Siemens has released new versions for several affected products and recommends to update to the latest versions. Siemens recommends specific countermeasures for products where fixes are not, or not yet available.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: 
https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: The use of Siemens Security Advisories is subject to the terms and conditions listed on: https://www.siemens.com/productcert/terms-of-use.
notes.title: Terms of Use

document.title: SSA-711309: Denial of Service Vulnerability in the OPC UA Implementations of SIMATIC Products

revision_history.summary: Added additional vulnerable products SIMATIC WinCC OA V3.17, SIMATIC WinCC OA V3.18, and SIMATIC WinCC OA V3.19; clarified that both ANSI C and C++ implementations are affected
Added additional vulnerable products SIMATIC BRAUMAT / SISTAR

Added SIMATIC Comfort/Mobile RT, SIMATIC IPC DiagMonitor, SIMATIC WinCC Unified OPC UA Client/Server, and SIMATIC PCS neo as affected products; removed unaffected devices: 6ES7513-1RL00-0AB0, 6ES7513-1RM03-0AB0, 6ES7515-2RM00-0AB0, 6ES7515-2RN03-0AB0, 6AG1515-2RM00-7AB0, 6AG2515-2RM00-4AB0, 6ES7517-3HP00-0AB0, 6AG1517-3HP00-4AB0, 6ES7518-4JP00-0AB0, 6AG1518-4JP00-4AB0; added fix for SIMATIC S7-PLCSIM Advanced
No fix planned for SIMATIC IPC DiagMonitor
Added fix for SIMATIC WinCC Unified OPC UA Client/Server; Added SIMATIC PCS 7 V9.1 as affected; Added specific mitigation measure for CVE-2023-28831 (disable OPC UA)

Removed unaffected device SIMATIC S7-1200 CPU family (incl. SIPLUS variants), added SIMATIC WinCC (Classic and Runtime Professional) and Totally Integrated Automation Portal to the list of affected devices, no fix planned for SIMATIC PCS 7 V9.1
Added SIMATIC NET PC Software as affected product; added fix for SIMATIC NET PC Software V17, V18; added fix for SIMATIC S7-1500 Software Controller V3; removed unaffected product TIA Portal
Added fix for SIMATIC ET 200SP Open Controller CPU 1515SP PC2 V30
Added fix for SIMATIC WinCC Runtime Professional V19
Added fix for SIMATIC WinCC V8.0
No fix planned for SIMATIC PCS neo V4.0; removed SIMATIC PCS neo V4.1 as not affected
No fix planned for SIMATIC Comfort/Mobile RT
Added fix for SIMATIC NET PC Software V16

notes.text:
The OPC UA implementations (ANSI C and C++) in affected products contain an integer overflow vulnerability that could cause the application to run into an infinite loop during certificate validation.

This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to create a denial of service condition by sending a specially crafted certificate.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Disable the OPC UA feature, if not used
Currently no fix is planned
